page.title: 13LOCAL OPINION ON "POOL"
page.content: We interviewed Mr John Groat, North Myre, who owns the land on which the excavation is situated. He is very interested in "the dig" and helped the archaeologists with the initial removal of the soil which covered the site, and has maintained a strong interest in the project. Although Mr Groat will not receive any payment for the use of the land, the site will be filled in and re-seeded when the project is finished. Mr Groat also holds the opinion that since the excavation was started there have been many more tourists to the South End, and along with the trade brought from the boarding of the archaeologists this has greatly increased the social activities of the area.
